intro: Photinia beauverdiana var. brevifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved photinia, is a shrub or small tree native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its elliptical, dark green leaves that are shorter and broader than those of the typical species. The plant produces small, white flowers in clusters, followed by red, fleshy fruits that are edible for certain bird species. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to provide habitat for wildlife.
